intro: Chaerophyllum temulum f. canescens, commonly known as the hairy cow parsley, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in umbrella-like clusters. The plant is native to Europe and is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is known for its aromatic foliage. The hairy texture of its stems and leaves is a distinguishing feature of this particular form.
